citations.narrative:
The facility has a written contingency plan (“Livestock Emergency Response Plan”) that was last reviewed January 18,
2023 (i.e. 2 years and 11 days from date of inspection on January 29, 2025). Contingency plans must be reviewed by the
research facility on at least an annual basis and any changes made from previous year’s review must be documented.
This is important to ensure the facility is prepared for the humane care and handling of animals in the event of an
emergency or disaster.
Correct by February 12, 2025 by reviewing the contingency plan annually and maintaining documentation of changes
made from the previous year’s review.

During the inspection two of the goat barn fencing panels were not in good repair. The four bucks housed in this area are
generally maintained in the pasture, but they have access to the barn for feeding and additional shelter during inclement
weather. The barn fence paneling consists of 8x8 inch metal wire squares and the wires have been broken such that one
fencing panel had four consecutive 8x8 inch squares that are no longer intact. The broken squares were creating 8-inch-
long sharp projecting points and a large horizontal opening that measured approximately 3.5 feet in length. A second barn
fence section had several consecutive 8x8 inch squares no longer intact creating a gaping 2ft x 5 ft hole with long
projecting wires. Some of the projecting wires were approximately 32 inches in length. Failure to maintain enclosure
fencing can cause projecting sharp wires to serve as a source of injury or holes that serve as an entrapment hazard to the
animals.
The affected fencing panels were removed on January 29, 2025 prior to the conclusion of the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
